commands.title: Commands
commands.description: A list of API functions for commands.

unregister.title: Unregister
unregister.description: Unregisters a command registered through Swiftly Commands.

registerrawalias.title: RegisterRawAlias

registeralias.title: RegisterAlias
registeralias.description: Registers an alias for a command registered through Swiftly Commands.

unregisteralias.title: UnregisterAlias

getcommands.description: Returns a list of the commands registered by this plugin.

getallcommands.title: GetAllCommands
getallcommands.description: Returns a list of the commands registered by all the plugins.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: A list of API functions for configuration.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> The config_key field supports nested configuration. Example: `folder1/folder2/config_key`, resulting in fetching to `folder1.folder2.config_key`.
The value needs to be a pair of key-values table in initial state, after it can also include lists and nested tables.

reload.title: Reload
reload.description: Reloads the configuration for the specified key.

fetcharraysize.title: FetchArraySize
fetcharraysize.description: Returns the array size of a config value.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns 0.

fetch.title: Fetch
fetch.description: Returns the configuration value for the specified key.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> If the key is invalid or the key is not an array key, it returns nil.

exists.title: Exists
exists.description: Returns if the configuration key exists.

convars.title: Convars
convars.description: A list of API functions for convars.

additional.lua: If the protected is set to true, no data will be sent by the server to the client about this convar.

existsfake.title: ExistsFake
existsfake.description: Checks if a fake convar exists.

addflags.title: AddFlags
addflags.description: Adds the flags to the convar.

removeflags.title: RemoveFlags
removeflags.description: Removes the flags from the convar.

hasflags.title: HasFlags
hasflags.description: Checks if a convar has the flags.

database.title: Database
database.description: A list of API functions for database.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description:
To use the Swiftly Database system you need the following code in your plugin.

> [!warning]
> Don't forget to replace CONNECTION_NAME with your own connection name.

content.lua:
```lua
AddEventHandler("OnPluginStart", function(event)
    db = Database("CONNECTION_NAME")
    return EventResult.Continue
end)
```

querybuilder.title: QueryBuilder
querybuilder.description: This is a class to build an SQL query.

additional.lua: `insert_values` is a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Data)
`update_values` is a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Data)
`columns` is a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Direction)
`columns` is a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Column Rules)

`addColumns` and `modifyColumns` are a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Column Rules)
`removeColumns` is a list of columns to be removed
`update_value` is a Key-Value Map (Key: Column, Value: Data)

> [!note]
> If the database is not connected it will return the same value.

> [!note] > If the database is not connected it will never execute.
> [!warning] > Works only with SQL databases.

> [!note]
> If the database is not connected it will never execute.

### Params
The parameters can be used by the following format inside the query string:
```
@key
[key]
{key}
```

Inside the parameters value it needs to be the following format
```lua
{
    ["key"] = value,
    ["key2"] = value,
    -- ...
}
```

The values can be a string, a number or a boolean. It will automatically convert to string form and perform EscapeString to it so that there would be no chance for SQL Injection.

> [!warning]
> Works only with SQL databases.

entities.title: Entities
entities.description: A list of API functions for entity management.

addhookentityoutput.title: AddHookEntityOutput
addhookentityoutput.description: Adds a hook output for an entity.

additional.lua:
#### Example
To hook an entity output, you need to specify the classname and the output you want, add an [AddPreHookListener](https://beta.swiftlycs2.net/plugin-docs/scripting/hooks/addprehooklistener) or an [AddPostHookListener](https://beta.swiftlycs2.net/plugin-docs/scripting/hooks/addposthooklistener) using the following event callback
```lua
local hookoutput = AddHookEntityOutput("weapon_knife", "*")
--- @param event Event
--- @param iooutput CEntityIOOutput
--- @param event_output string
--- @param activator CEntityInstance
--- @param caller CEntityInstance
--- @param delay number
--- @return number|nil EventResult
AddPreHookListener(hookoutput, function(event, iooutput, event_output, activator, caller, delay)
    -- In this example we're listening to all the outputs of weapon_knife.
    return EventResult.Continue
end)
```

findentitiesbyclassname.title: FindEntitiesByClassname
findentitiesbyclassname.description: Returns all the `CEntityInstance` for all the entities available with the specified classname.

createentitybyname.title: CreateEntityByName
createentitybyname.description: Creates an entity by the provided class name.

additional.lua:
To see a complete list of class names and the specific entity class, see the following link: [https://cs2.poggu.me/dumped-data/entity-list](https://cs2.poggu.me/dumped-data/entity-list).

This list is provided by Poggu on it's own website for Counter Strike 2.

events.title: Events
events.description: A list of events provided by Swiftly API.

event.title: Event
event.description:
This is the Event class.
Generates an event object to trigger a game event from Counter Strike: 2.
The event names are being listed inside [Game Events](https://swiftlycs2.net/docs/scripting/events/gameevents/).

core.title: Core Events
core.description: A list of the game events implemented by Swiftly Core.

onpluginstart.title: OnPluginStart
onpluginstart.description: This game event is triggered when the plugin starts.

onpluginstop.title: OnPluginStop
onpluginstop.description: This game event is triggered when the plugin stops.

onallpluginsloaded.title: OnAllPluginsLoaded
onallpluginsloaded.description: This game event is triggered when all the plugins are loaded.

onmapload.title: OnMapLoad
onmapload.description: This game event is triggered when a map loads.

onmapunload.title: OnMapUnload
onmapunload.description: This game event is triggered when a map unloads.

ongametick.title: OnGameTick
ongametick.description: This game event is called at every server tick.

onclientdisconnect.title: OnClientDisconnect
onclientdisconnect.description: This game event is triggered when a client disconnects.

onterminateround.title: OnTerminateRound
onterminateround.description: This game event is triggered when CGameRules->TerminateRound is being called.

onentityacceptinput.title: OnEntityAcceptInput
onentityacceptinput.description: This game event is triggered when an entity receives an input.

onplayerchecktransmit.title: OnPlayerCheckTransmit
onplayerchecktransmit.description: This game event is triggered when a player checks for transmitting entities.

onclientconnect.title: OnClientConnect
onclientconnect.description: This game event is triggered when a client connects.

onentityspawned.title: OnEntitySpawned
onentityspawned.description: This game event is triggered when an entity is spawned on the server.

onentitycreated.title: OnEntityCreated
onentitycreated.description: This game event is triggered when an entity is created on the server.

onentitydeleted.title: OnEntityDeleted
onentitydeleted.description: This game event is triggered when an entity is deleted from the server.

onclientkeystatechange.title: OnClientKeyStateChange
onclientkeystatechange.description: This game event is triggered when a key state changes for a client.

onclientconvarquery.title: OnClientConvarQuery
onclientconvarquery.description: This game event is triggered when a player's convar is being queried.

onclientcommand.title: OnClientCommand
onclientcommand.description: This game event is triggered when a client sends a command.

onclientchat.title: OnClientChat
onclientchat.description: This game event is triggered when a player sends a text message.

onplayerdamage.title: OnPlayerDamage
onplayerdamage.description: This game event is triggered when a player receives damage.

onplayerpostthink.title: OnPlayerPostThink
onplayerpostthink.description: This game event is triggered when the hook CCSPlayerPawnBase_PostThink is being called.

additional.lua:
#### How can I stop the execution?
Simply return `EventResult.Stop` and it will be blocked.

onusermessagesend.title: OnUserMessageSend
onusermessagesend.description: This game event is triggered when a user message is being sent to a player.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> The methods to get the clients are preset in [UserMessage](https://beta.swiftlycs2.net/plugin-docs/scripting/usermessages/usermessage) class: AddClient, RemoveClient, ClearClients, AddClients and GetClients.

#### How can I stop the execution of a User Message?
Simply return `EventResult.Stop` and it will be blocked.

#### How can I get the UserMessage?
To get the user message object, you need to use [GetUserMessage](https://beta.swiftlycs2.net/plugin-docs/scripting/utils/misc/getusermessage) along with the `usermessage_uuid` parameter.

hooks.title: Hooks

additional.lua:
Below will be listed a table for all the data types for args list and return type:

|         Data Types        | Value |
|:-------------------------:|:-----:|
|         `Pointer`         |  `p`  |
|          `Float`          |  `f`  |
|         `Boolean`         |  `b`  |
|          `Double`         |  `d`  |
|         `Integer`         |  `i`  |
|     `Unsigned Integer`    |  `u`  |
|       `string`       |  `s`  |
|      `64-bit Integer`     |  `I`  |
| `64-bit Unsigned Integer` |  `U`  |
|           `Void`          |  `v`  |

menus.title: Menus
menus.description: A list of API functions for menus.

register.title: Register
register.description: Registers a menu by a specific ID.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> The color needs to be a hex string by the model RRGGBB.

> Example: 344CEB 

> [!warning]
> The options needs to be a pair of strings.

```lua
{
    { "option 1", "value 1" },
    { "option 2", "value 2" },
    -- ...
}
```
> [!warning]
> The value can be replaced with a command from Swiftly and it's arguments, or it can be replaced with a menu id to open another menu.
> The value can be also a blank string to not execute anything when it's selected.

registertemporary.title: RegisterTemporary
registertemporary.description: Registers a temporary menu by a specific ID.

additional.lua:
> [!note]
> The color needs to be a hex string by the model RRGGBB.

> Example: 344CEB 

> [!warning]
> The options needs to be a pair of strings.

```lua
{
    { "option 1", "value 1" },
    { "option 2", "value 2" },
    -- ...
}
```
> [!warning]
> The value can be replaced with a command from Swiftly and it's arguments, or it can be replaced with a menu id to open another menu.
> The value can be also a blank string to not execute anything when it's selected.

unregister.description:
Unregistered a menu by the specified id.
> [!note]
> It can unregister only the menus which were created from the inside of the plugin.

translation.title: Translation
translation.description: A list of API functions for translation files.

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.description: To use Swiftly Translation system you need to create a `JSON` file in `translations` folder with the following schema:

content.lua:
#### File Name
```
translation.MAIN_TRANSLATION_KEY.json
```

#### File Content
```json
{
    "key1.key2": {
        "en": "English Translation",
        "ro": "Traducere Romn"
    },
    ...
}
```

fetchtranslation.title: FetchTranslation
fetchtranslation.description:
Returns the translation for the specified key.
> [!warning]
> the translation key is non-existent for the specified language in core.json, it returns the the translation key.

> [!note]
> Key Format: MAIN_TRANSLATION_KEY.TRANSLATION_KEY

> Example: test_plugin.core.started

switch.title: Switch
switch.description: Allows for a switch-like behavior in Lua, matching a value against a set of cases. It supports functions or direct values for each case and includes a default fallback.

additional.lua:
#### Example
```lua
local result = switch("hello", {
    hello = function() return "world" end,
    goodbye = "farewell",
    default = function() return "unknown" end
})
print(result) -- Output: world
```

tablemap.title: Table Map
tablemap.description: Maps a given function to each element in a table, returning a new table with the transformed values.

tablefilter.title: Table Filter
tablefilter.description: Filters elements of a table based on a provided predicate function, returning a new table with elements that satisfy the condition.

tablecontains.description: Checks if a table contains a specific value.

tablefind.title: Table Find
tablefind.description: Return the index of the value.

isvaliditem.title: IsValidItem
isvaliditem.description: Checks if the provided item name is valid.

isvalidweapon.title: IsValidWeapon
isvalidweapon.description: Checks if the provided weapon name is valid.

usermessages.title: User Messages
usermessages.description: A list of API functions for user messages.

usermessage.title: UserMessage
usermessage.description: A user message is a wrapper for protobuf messages.

list.title: User Messages List
list.description:
A list of all user messages can be found at the following link:
[https://gist.github.com/psychonic/f529f20a02f6d78d56513127ff720683#file-usermessages-proto](https://gist.github.com/psychonic/f529f20a02f6d78d56513127ff720683#file-usermessages-proto)

weapons.title: Weapons
weapons.description: A list of API functions for weapons.

weaponsmanager.title: Weapons Manager
weaponsmanager.description: A list of API functions for weapons manager.

giveweapon.title: GiveWeapon
giveweapon.description: Gives the specified weapon to player.

removebyclassname.title: RemoveByClassname
removebyclassname.description: Removes the weapons with the specified classname.

removebyslot.title: RemoveBySlot
removebyslot.description: Removes the weapons with the specified slot.

removebyitemdefinition.title: RemoveByItemDefinition
removebyitemdefinition.description: Removes the weapons with the specified item definition index.

getfirstinslot.title: GetFIrstInSlot
getfirstinslot.description: Returns the first weapon in the specified slot.

getinslot.title: GetInSlot
getinslot.description: Returns the weapons in the specified slot.

removeweapons.title: RemoveWeapons
removeweapons.description: Removes all the weapons of the player.

dropweapons.title: DropWeapons
dropweapons.description: Drops all the weapons of the player.

getweapons.title: GetWeapons
getweapons.description: Returns a table of all the player weapons.

weapon.title: Weapon
weapon.description: A weapon is an object which stores informations about a player's weapon.
